meanings.definition: In a white manner or color.
meanings.sent1: The snow fell whitely on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The clouds drifted whitely across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The ghost was dressed whitely, blending in with the fog.
meanings.sent4: Her face turned whitely pale when she heard the news.
meanings.sent5: The moon shone whitely in the dark night sky.

meanings.sent1: The laundry detergent whitely cleaned the stained shirt.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old paint whitely faded on the fence.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand whitely transformed the red scarf into white.
meanings.sent4: His lies whitely bleached the truth from the story.
meanings.sent5: The sun whitely bleached the colorful fabric on the clothesline.
